thread.title: Whisenhunt on Mariota hit: 'B.S.' football

author: Nate Davis, USA TODAY Sports
title: Whisenhunt on Mariota hit: 'B.S.' football
text:
Whisenhunt on Mariota hit: 'B.S.' football USA Today Sports 4 hrs ago by Nate Davis, USA TODAY Sports In the aftermath of a 1-3 start capped by a coaching change, the Miami Dolphins spent the past few weeks ratcheting up their intensity on the practice field under new field boss Dan Campbell.
AdChoices Perhaps too much given what transpired Sunday.
Though the Dolphins played to the level many predicted they could reach prior to the season, thrashing the Tennessee Titans 38-10, they were also accused of crossing the line. Defensive end Olivier Vernon seems very likely to find his paycheck docked by the NFL this week after he went late and low into the left knee of Titans quarterback Marcus Mariota, who remained in the game but limped through the remainder of it following Vernon’s second-quarter shot, which drew a roughing-the-passer penalty.
"I think it was done with the idea of trying to hurt our QB and that's (expletive) football,” Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt said after watching his prized rookie jeopardized.
Mariota was sacked six times and hit seven times in total. He said afterward, “I’m all right.”
Mariota admitted he hadn’t seen a replay of the hit following the loss and thus had no opinion on it but did say Vernon apologized to him after the game.
Follow Nate Davis on Twitter @ByNateDavis .
